p: Nichols et al. (2009) [ 109] undertook a systematic review on health, climate change and energy vulnerability, searching for papers published in English between 1998 and 2008. They retrieved 114 papers but included only 36 in their final analysis. Bouzid et al. (2013) undertook a “systematic review of systematic reviews” to explore the effectiveness of public health interventions to reduce the health impact of climate change [ 110]. This identified over 3100 unique records, but of these, only 85 full papers were assessed, with 33 included in the final review.
